title: Transamerica Redwood Park
desc: Located in the shadow of the Transamerica Pyramid, Redwood Park is one of the Financial District's greenest and most serene spots. Here, towering redwoods surround a half acre of statues and a large central water feature. Plus, the park is often empty, which means there's almost always a bench available for the hogging. Potential visitors take note: The park is closed every evening.

title: 50 California Street
desc: 50 California Street is a prominent office building located in the heart of San Francisco's Financial District. The building features a spacious lobby, modern amenities, and easy access to public transportation.

title: 101 California Street
desc: 101 California Street is a landmark skyscraper in San Francisco. The building is known for its distinctive cylindrical shape and glass facade. It offers stunning views of the city and the bay.

title: Union Square
desc: Union Square is a major commercial and cultural hub in San Francisco. It is known for its upscale shopping, dining, and entertainment options. The square is also a popular gathering place for events and performances.

title: Yerba Buena Gardens
desc: Yerba Buena Gardens is a vibrant public space in the heart of San Francisco. The gardens feature beautiful landscaping, public art installations, and a variety of cultural attractions. It is a great place to relax and enjoy the outdoors.
